result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathy Lynn Nowakowski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Kathy Lynn Nowakowski.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a date for plea and sentencing.  Court accepts misdemeanor cases from Branch 1 for global resolution.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  

Defense requests to be heard on bail.  Bail motion by Defense argued and denied by the Court. Current bail previously set remains in place.  All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion for Modification of Bail

2:20 PM Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Kathy Lynn Nowakowski.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Kathy Lynn Nowakowski.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Michael Plaisted as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Plaisted accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $20.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 11/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. 

Parties are pursuing global resolution; Court will accept defendants other cases for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski not in court, in custody. Attorney Michael Plaisted appears by video as a friend of the court. Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defendant is not SPD Eligible. Attorney Michael Plaisted motions for an adjournment to be retained for the case. Court agrees to adjournment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing to the trial court.
Indigency hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT, LEVEL 5, for supervision. Defendant was taken into custody.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug test.
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT ONCE RELEASED FROM CUSTODY AN A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Kathy Lynn Nowakowski in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Defendant enters a not guity plea as to the misdemeanor count. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/17/2022@1pm
